thread.title: Atlanta changes city ordinance so people can get drunk after Super Bowl
thread.title_full: Atlanta changes city ordinance so people can get drunk after Super Bowl

title: Atlanta changes city ordinance so people can get drunk after Super Bowl
text:
Georgia National Guard file, flickr SOURCE: Georgia National Guard file, flickr Atlanta changes city ordinance so people can get drunk after Super Bowl 
Normally, bars in Atlanta can only serve alcohol until 12:30 a.m., but that will be extended for two hours for Super Bowl LI Updated: 6:07 PM   
The city of Atlanta is getting ready for a Super Bowl celebration, and wants to make sure everyone gets to extend the party with a couple extra beers. Advertisement 
Normally, bars in Atlanta can only serve alcohol until 12:30 a.m., but an executive order drafted specifically for Super Bowl LI will allow patrons to imbibe until 2:30 a.m. Monday. 
But will they be toasting Matt Ryan and the rest of their new local champions or mourning the Falcons as Tom Brady's chiseled jaw shines underneath a flurry of red, white and blue confetti? Only time will tell. 
"In celebration of the Atlanta Falcons winning the NFC Championship and our home team's participation in Super Bowl LI, we have extended the hours alcohol can be served at City of Atlanta licensed businesses on February 5, Super Bowl Sunday," Mayor Kasim Reed said in a press release . 
"It's time to rise up, Atlanta, and we encourage everyone to rise up in a safe fashion."
